intro: Oenothera xenogaura, commonly known as the yellow evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Oenothera xenogaura is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other evening primrose species.
